column1: No matter how much Norse manure you splatter on to them, they 've a habit of coming up smelling of roses.

column1: I don't know why we drink so much and come up smelling of roses.

column1: But this first impression is grossly misleading — as you 'd realise if you heard Diversion's rather wonderful EP, ‘ BZ’— four short, sharp pop songs which roll around experimentally in a wide field of influences and still come up smelling of roses, mainly because they 're all squashed together into spunky two and a half minute blasts.

column1: I 've played it fast and loose before, and on the rare occasions when I 've disobeyed orders ( in the Rhineland during the First Crusade, in a little whorehouse in the backstreets of Byzantium, and on a cargo ship bearing perfumes from Punt ) I have come up smelling of roses.
